name: Mise en Place Setup
description: Prepare and organize all ingredients before cooking
problem: Ingredients not ready when needed, steps get delayed
solution: Gather, measure, and prepare all ingredients before starting cooking
steps: Read recipe completely
Gather all ingredients
Wash, peel, chop vegetables
Measure spices and liquids into small bowls
Arrange ingredients in cooking order
examples: Professional chefs always use mise en place

name: Knife Skills: Basic Cuts
description: Fundamental knife techniques for consistent cooking
problem: Uneven pieces cook unevenly, affecting texture and timing
solution: Use proper knife techniques for consistent, uniform cuts
steps: Hold knife properly (pinch grip)
Use claw grip for holding food
Rock chop for herbs
Straight slice for round vegetables
Keep knives sharp

name: Batch Preparation Alternative
description: Prepare ingredients in batches for multiple meals
problem: Same ingredients prepared repeatedly across meals
solution: Prep larger quantities once, use across multiple recipes
steps: Plan meals for the week
Identify common ingredients
Batch chop vegetables
Store in airtight containers
Use within 3-5 days

name: Temperature Control: Sear then Bake
description: Start with high heat for searing, finish with lower heat
problem: Food burns on outside before inside is cooked
solution: Use two-stage cooking: high heat sear, then finish in oven
steps: Preheat oven to finishing temperature (350-400°F)
Heat pan on high heat with oil
Sear food 2-3 minutes per side
Transfer to oven
Cook until internal temperature reached
examples: Steak: sear in cast iron, finish at 400°F
Chicken thighs: crispy skin, moist interior

name: Reverse Sear Method
description: Cook low and slow first, then sear at the end
problem: Traditional sear creates overcooked outer layer
solution: Reverse order: slow cook to temperature, then quick sear
steps: Season meat and let rest at room temperature
Cook in low oven (225-250°F) until 10-15°F below target
Rest 10 minutes
Sear in hot pan 1 minute per side
Serve immediately

Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
